alert.note: Alert for Northern Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Columbia, southeastern Echols, south central Ware, southeastern Clinch and west central Charlton Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 729 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Stephen Foster State Park to 6 miles southwest of Fargo. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Fargo and Stephen Foster State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
